children.subject: Get 61A over with over the summer and you can find some time to do interview prep questions and study data structures/algos (CTCI is a great resource) on the side. If you have a similar data structures class, also look into CS 47B (self-paced alternative to 61B for students with CC credit in data structures). Good luck!

Its not that so much that students get internships after 61B specifically. Its that by the time they take it, they have some CS maturity and get a good understanding of data structures from 61B. If you already know data structures well, then there isn't really an issue there. I will guarantee that no company (unless a Berkeley CS alum) will even know what 61B is. They only care that you have a good understanding of data structures. If you don't have that, then I might consider taking 61BL. Still, a lot of it can be self-learned and Cracking the Coding interview is great to practice.

history.content: Definitely take CS 61A first if you can. The student explanation below about maturity is spot on. Thanks!

Hello, I'm an incoming junior transfer as intended-cs. I’ve been reading some posts and they indicate that many CS/EECS students land an internship after taking CS61B. Because internship/job fairs mostly happen during Fall semester, I’m little bit concerned. Should I take CS61BL over summer instead of taking CS61A?
history.subject: CS61BL (summer) before CS61A?
